column4: this is definitely an ubuntu bug -- i'm not seeing the entity → although perhaps it's numeric
probably the font doesn't include it
on the second page, the first line of the history shows three funny characters on my screen -- what do you see?
i see that as a rarr on xchat, no prob
and on the first page i linked, also no prob
sec, let me play with firebug for a sec
probably related, this page shows funny chars in the middle of the image dimension lines: http://beyondeuclid.com/wiki/Image:Playground_Pythagoras.png
so, eg, 144 ?? 72 px -- except that the ?s are non standard reversed out of black diamonds -- placeholders, i guess
well, strictly speaking it's exactly the standard of what you're supposed to do if a renderer is presented with an unknown entity
I can splice → into that page and have it work though, give me another sec :p
I'm suspicious that your webserver is changing something out on you
i understand that on some level this is a graceful failure -- but it's still a failure -- do i need to install another font or is the issue deeper?
what's the difference between those two pages?  is it just that one uses the char directly, and the other uses the xml entity?
i'm talking to a guy on #mediawiki about this -- would you please join #codebug
